title: Manyu-Wana 4 (A)
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Aboriginal Australians - Language - Study and teaching

description: Episode number 4 of Series "Manyu-Wana (A)". This episode covers the following topics: Magic; spear-straightening in a fire and hunting for kangaroo; baby magic; words for 'big' and 'little' using different clothes being washed; collecting red ochre form a cave at Karrku, near Nyirrpi; working at the powerhouse; picking up rubbish; reading of "The Snake and the Goanna"; band magic; Nyirrpi tractor. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.
